website_summaries.verdict: The beauty and aesthetics of enamel cast iron braisers at a lower price point.
pros: Nice large handle on the top is easy to use
Also comes in cobalt or red
Porcelain enamel exterior is beautiful on and off the table
Does a good job of searing
Wider and shallower than some pots
cons: The side handles on this model are a little small

customer_reviews.title: Cooking surface is 9.5 inches
customer_reviews.text: This braiser’s dimensions is described as 18.1 x 14.6 x 6.9 inches. The cooking surface is 9.5 inches, too small for a braiser. I returned it for this reason. Otherwise, it is well-made. Color is beautiful. Anolon’s marketing say their enamel products are made in China or Thailand. The product I received did not have any indication at all on the pot, lid or box about where it was made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cleans up easy. Heavy duty cooking pot.
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't seem to stick much and it cleans up with the rough back of the sponge. Seems to sear well. Not sure if it heats evenly, but that could be user error. I like it. Seems like it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: M-D

customer_reviews.title: It can take the heat, so it stays in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.text: See my 5 star review of "Anolon Vesta Cast Iron Cookware 7-Quart Round Covered Casserole, Paprika Red". I haven't used this 5 quart braiser yet, but since it's just a smaller shorter version of the casserole, it should perform equally well.
customer_reviews.author: James Tunnicliffe

customer_reviews.title: Braiser with a good value
customer_reviews.text: I have some higher end enameled cookware and this one is a very good value compared with them. It does exactly what I would expect an enameled braiser to do and at a good value. I am giving it four stars because the fit and finish isn’t great, but this shouldn’t have much, if any, effect on the functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: High quality cooking
customer_reviews.text: I needed a braising pot that was wider and more shallow than most 5 qt pots tend to be. I used this braiser to make a tagine that I had been making for years in a Pyrex, and this took it to the next level completely. My family couldn't get over how the same food became exponentially more moist, flavorful and delicious. The ease of use, even heating and beautiful design have me completely sold. This is my first piece of cast iron cookware, but I'm afraid that anything I buy after this will be a disappointment! With its beautiful looks and superior cooking abilities the bar has been set high.
customer_reviews.author: dovorbabs

customer_reviews.title: It looks good on my cooktop
customer_reviews.text: I looks good in person and performs really well. I was actually surprised.
customer_reviews.author: songiso

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful cast iron dish, but you better be strong to use it. This cast iron braiser is heavy. The finish is a wonderful red color. Basically it is a cast iron utensil with an enamel coating and due to this there is no reason to season the pot. We love it so far. It is a very versatile size and can go from oven to table. Very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great braising dish
customer_reviews.text: I love this. This is a perfect braiser, wide and deep (but much shallower than a Dutch oven). It is enamel on the outside, but cast iron on the inside. It is very heavy duty, but looks nice and works well. It's a fantastic shape for braised casseroles or other dishes. It's big and a go-to for several meals in our house.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Nelson

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cast iron pot and lid. I love the color, style, and cooking in cast iron. Also be sure to follow the directions, so that this cookware well last. And know that it is very heavy.
customer_reviews.author: T. Gaston

customer_reviews.title: Haven't used it yet but it looks so nice. By that I mean in visual appeal and ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet but it looks so nice. By that I mean in visual appeal and quality. I think once I get to use it I will be even happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: KeikoJM

customer_reviews.title: Solid, heavy cast iron cookware
customer_reviews.text: This pan easily compares with other, pricier models in the same category. It's got a nice look to it and the heft that you'd expect from cast iron, but more importantly, it cooks well. The basic features (handles on either side, curved lid handle - better than a nob!) are nice, but ultimately, it's how well it cooks that matters. We've been using it for a few months in the oven and on the stovetop, and aside from normal seasoning, it's not showing much sign of wear. It cooks evenly and thoroughly and I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This is a premium quality piece of cookware that delivers. It is a beautiful color, heavy duty (and heavy!), wonderful cast iron for even heat distribution and a very nice, heavy duty lid as well. Very easy to clean. A very useful size. Great in the oven or on the stove top. Very versatile. I cannot imagine anyone not loving this pot. It would make an excellent gift for that special chef/cook friend or a wonderful addiction to your own kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Bron

customer_reviews.title: One tough pot
customer_reviews.text: If a pot can be beautiful, then this one is just that. This thing does weigh around 10 lbs! It is iron. Beautiful finish on the outside. Perfect for making stove top stews and winter chili!. Perfect size and height for stews or stir fry. Cleanup is not so easy because of the weight, but I realized this. Otherwise as long as it is dried well, it will keep on looking great. Great idea for any level of home chefs.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Alan
